intro: Peucedanum nyassicum, commonly known as the Alpine angelica, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Peucedanum nyassicum is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
